to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess

sentences.english: The papers contained no requests for managers.
sentences.chinese: 报纸上没有登招聘经理的启事。

sentences.english: Today I attended a job fair.
sentences.chinese: 今天我参加了一个招聘会。
她的工作跟招聘人才有关。

sentences.english: Some of you are bound to have met with disappointment in the recruiting season.
sentences.chinese: 在招聘季节中，你们当中有的人注定要与失望为伍。

sentences.english: The OCOG may establish a functional area dealing with Recruitment aspects.
sentences.chinese: 组委会可以设立专门的职能部门办理招聘有关事宜。
但是，招聘人员却非常注重按类别来划分。

sentences.english: Mr. Burke was able to quiz the recruiters almost exclusively through email.
sentences.chinese: 布尔克可以基本上只通过电子邮件向招聘人员提问。

sentences.english: Businesses will hire wherever the highly-skilled, highly-trained workers are located.
sentences.chinese: 企业将到训练有素的高技能人才聚集地招聘。

sentences.english: Recruiters told them the salaries were very good, but they were asked for money.
sentences.chinese: 招聘者对他们说工资非常不错，但需要介绍费。

sentences.english: The banks tend to employ only white middle-class men.
sentences.chinese: 银行总是只招聘中产阶级的白人男士。

sentences.english: The help-wanted ads are the first things I look at in Sunday's paper.
sentences.chinese: 在星期日的报纸上，我首先看的是招聘广告。

sentences.english: The publishing firm was advertising for a typist.
sentences.chinese: 这家出版公司正在登广告招聘一名打字员。

sentences.english: Another year recruiting season, the campus, curriculum vitae in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 又是一年招聘季，校园里，简历在风中飘荡。

sentences.english: During a phone interview the candidate flushed the toilet while talking to hiring manager.
sentences.chinese: 应聘者在一次电话面试外边和招聘经理谈话边冲马桶。

sentences.english: Career Fairs are a great way to network face-to-face with local and national employers.
sentences.chinese: 招聘会是和本地及全国的雇主面对面交流的好机会。

sentences.english: With the rapid business developed, we need staffers suitable for the following requirements.
sentences.chinese: 现因业务急需要招聘符合以下条件的职员。
